author: Joshua Fluke
description:
Employee anniversaries on LinkedIn are wild. Thirty years at a company and you get… a photo? A banner? A certificate no one knows what to do with? In this video, I break down the funniest and cringiest employee anniversary “celebrations,” from 35-year loyalty awards that amount to a LinkedIn selfie to companies giving workers 10 minutes in Costco like it’s a game show.

Why do companies act like employees choose whether they get fired? Why do they post these like they’re delivering Oscars instead of paper certificates? And what happens to all these posts when the employee quietly disappears?

We’re roasting corporate appreciation culture, staged gratitude, and the weirdest anniversary traditions companies pretend are meaningful. Tell me your best (or worst) employee anniversary gift in the comments.

Like and subscribe for more corporate nonsense breakdowns.

title: 35 Years of work… For THIS? - EMPLOYEE ANNIVERSARIES
